My name is Tassio and I am a game designer currently studying Communication and Multimedia Design, Game Design at the Hanze University of Applied Sciences in Groningen, Netherlands.
I am very passionate about games. I enjoy exploring new worlds & discussing interesting ideas. So if you want to talk about anything just send me a message!

.quickfacts { table-layout: fixed; width: 100%; white-space: nowrap; font-size: 0.9em; padding-top: 1em; padding-bottom: 2em; } .quickfacts td { white-space: nowrap; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis; } .col-1 { width: 10%; } .col-2 { width: 50%; }  Quick Facts   Live Link Work in Progress   Client SnowLimits Ski Center Groningen   Team Size 5   Engine Unity   Platform Oculus Quest    Information  .youtube-caption { padding: 5px 10px; position: relative; bottom: 10px; right: 0px; margin: 0 auto; padding: 2px 5px; color: #fff; font-size: .7em; background: #000; text-align: right; z-index: 5; opacity: 0.65; border-radius: 0 0 5px 5px; }   Skyline Product Showcase   Client: Snowlimits Ski Center Groningen Snowlimits offers indoor skiing and snowboarding on an endless indoor roller track. Check out the Snowlimits website  for more information.
Graphic (c) by Snowlimits  SnowLimits approached us with the idea of making their indoor skiing slopes more exciting with the addition of VR.
We created a game that will let their teachers choose a tailored exercise with adjustable difficulty levels to match the customers needs.
The data from the VR headset gets sent to a server in the cloud which validates it and then sends it to our smartphone app right into the hands of the teacher so that he can see his student’s view alongside all the data he needs.
We also integrated hand tracking so more advanced students could train on their own by adjusting settings directly in the game!
 Roles & Responsibilities Game Design  Concept for the communication of the app with the game on the Oculus Quest through a server Concept for VR gameplay VR Controls  Level Design  Replicated real life dimensions of slope in VR & added a mountain terrain  Code  Player character UI Sounds VR setup & Hand tracking Server communication  Art  Universal Render Pipeline integration Post processing  More  Workshop to explain Unity & Servers to the group Skiing on the slope in VR   Media Skyline

The VR version is still in progress.
The player controls a mailman on a pogo stick with a grappling hook in each hand to traverse the challenging environment.
The focus is entirely on gameplay with free movement and simple goals limited by time and the environment.

.quickfacts { table-layout: fixed; width: 100%; white-space: nowrap; font-size: 0.9em; padding-top: 1em; padding-bottom: 2em; } .quickfacts td { white-space: nowrap; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis; } .col-1 { width: 10%; } .col-2 { width: 50%; }  Quick Facts   Live Link Work in Progress   Client Hanze University   Team Size 6   Engine Unity   Platform Windows, MacOS, Linux    Information  .youtube-caption { padding: 5px 10px; position: relative; bottom: 10px; right: 0px; margin: 0 auto; padding: 2px 5px; color: #fff; font-size: .7em; background: #000; text-align: right; z-index: 5; opacity: 0.65; border-radius: 0 0 5px 5px; }   Defiance   We received the task to create an emergent game in a group. The result is a blend of platforming and challenging puzzles set in a procedurally generated labyrinth that’s deeply rooted in Greek mythology.
The labyrinth houses many dangers and secrets, from traps and enemies, to hidden items and potions.
At the end of it three Greek goddesses await you to test your wits and give you a different reward depending on how you choose to deal with the situation.

The player gets to experience how prevalent smoking was in the past and then travel into the future after accomplishing a few tasks.
We used tunneling to help immerse the players more while simultaneously lessening nausea.

The player can steer the car with the arrow keys and uses the WASD keys to control the speed of the propellers and the angle of the rudders.
The goal is to compete against simple opponents which drive a normal car and others which just fly by to finish the race in first place.
